title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for split at x = 3

1 point is earned for antiderivative 2 ( x−4 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaWPeqaaaaa aaaaWdbiaaikdadaqadaqaaiaadIhacqGHsislcaaI0aaacaGLOaGa ayzkaaWaaWbaaSqabeaacaaIYaaaaaaa@3C9D@

1 point is earned for answer

∫ 1 6 g(x)d x= ∫ 1 3 g(x)d x+ ∫ 3 6 g(x)d x                    = ∫ 1 3 2d x+ ∫ 3 6 2 (x−4) 2 d x                    =4+ [ 2 3 (x−4) 3 ] x=3 x=6 =4+ 16 3 −( − 2 3 )=10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@9EAF@

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for intervals

1 point is earned for reason

The graph of f is increasing and concave up on 0 < x < 1 and 4 < x < 6 because f'(x) = g(x) > 0 and f'(x) = g(x) is increasing on those intervals.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for intervals

1 point is earned for reason

The graph of f is increasing and concave up on 0 < x < 1 and 4 < x < 6 because f'(x) = g(x) > 0 and f'(x) = g(x) is increasing on those intervals.

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for intervals

1 point is earned for reason

The graph of f is increasing and concave up on 0 < x < 1 and 4 < x < 6 because f'(x) = g(x) > 0 and f'(x) = g(x) is increasing on those intervals.

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for intervals

1 point is earned for reason

The graph of f is increasing and concave up on 0 < x < 1 and 4 < x < 6 because f'(x) = g(x) > 0 and f'(x) = g(x) is increasing on those intervals.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for answer

1 point is earned for reason

The graph of f has a point of inflection at x = 4 because f'(x) = g(x) changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 4.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for answer

1 point is earned for reason

The graph of f has a point of inflection at x = 4 because f'(x) = g(x) changes from decreasing to increasing at x = 4.
